Package project1.algorithm

Class ThreadAnalytics

  • java.lang.Object
    • project1.algorithm.ThreadAnalytics
  • public class ThreadAnalytics
extends java.lang.Object
    A ThreadAnalytics singleton is used to manage a thread pool for the DFS algorithm, and keeps track of the best Schedule.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void addThread​(DFSThread t)
      Add a Scheduler thread to the thread pool, and run it.

      Updates the best finish time and its schedule.
      int numThreadsAlive()
      Get the current number of threads running.
      int numThreadsSpawned()
      Get the total number of threads that have been created over the course of the algorithm.
      boolean threadNeeded()
      Determine whether or not enough threads are currently running.

      • getInstance

        public static ThreadAnalytics getInstance​(int threads)
        Instantiate an instance of ThreadAnalytics, and return it.
        Parameters:
        threads - Number of threads required, to be running in parallel.
        Returns:
        The single ThreadAnalytics instance.

      • getInstance

        public static ThreadAnalytics getInstance()
        Return the single ThreadAnalytics instance.
        Returns:
        The single ThreadAnalytics instance.

      • newSchedule

        public void newSchedule​(int time,
                        PartialSchedule s)
        Updates the best finish time and its schedule. Called by threads after they have produced a complete schedule, every time.
        Parameters:
        time - Time for the produced schedule to run.
        s - The produced schedule.

      • getGlobalBestTime

        public int getGlobalBestTime()
        Returns the time of the best schedule.
        Returns:
        The time taken to run the best schedule.

      • addThread

        public void addThread​(DFSThread t)
        Add a Scheduler thread to the thread pool, and run it.
        Parameters:
        t - The Scheduler thread to be run.

      • threadNeeded

        public boolean threadNeeded()
        Determine whether or not enough threads are currently running.
        Returns:
        If the number of current threads running is lesser than required.

      • decThreadsAlive

        public void decThreadsAlive()
        Decrement the number of threads running.

      • numThreadsAlive

        public int numThreadsAlive()
        Get the current number of threads running.
        Returns:
        Number of threads running (alive).

      • numThreadsSpawned

        public int numThreadsSpawned()
        Get the total number of threads that have been created over the course of the algorithm.
        Returns:
        Total number of threads created.

      • waitTillDone

        public void waitTillDone()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for all threads to die.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - When interrupted
